comments.commentBody: In watching the debate tonight, it is clear that Presdent Obama was the decisive winner. Governor Romney is a stiff animatron who creates facts as he goes. He comes across as an over-practiced talking head who needs a haircut. Mr. Obama comes across as sincere and knowledgeable. He deserves 4 more years. I am a senior who is part of the "pathetic 47% percent victim population. Mr. Obama was brilliant on the last question as he talked about his concern for 100% of the people, not just 53% of us.
Romney doubled down as the out-and-out bully he was in the first debate, but Ms. Crowley handled it better than Mr. Lehrer

I made a donation to the Obama campaign (which I had not done so far) as soon as the debate was over. I was thrilled to see Obama call  Romney a liar in his face, and still be presidential about it. Four more years !!!!
You know you can go on Youtube and listen to what the president said yourself, right? This is 2012, you don't need to rely on Fake News to know what's going on.

Moderator Crowley has admitted she was wrong about Libya, and Obama stating it was a terrorist attack. Her confrontation of Governor Romney was blatantly wrong and off the wall.
Some day perhaps we will have a fair press once again. However, that will not happen under another Obama administration.

Give me your tired, your poor, your binders full of women, yearning to breathe free... and work for less.

Binders. Because that's equality under Romney.
No, thanks.

Obama 2012.

CHEERS FOR OBAMA-THE CLEAR WINNER!

In command of the facts and of himself...thank you, Mr. President, for standing your ground: the ground of truth and compassion for all the American people.

Brilliant timing on the 47%...worth waiting for...couldn't have been better, leaving Mr. Romney no opportunity to rebut (which would have been yet another lie).

Romney on the other hand was short-tempered, visibly angry, incredibly rude, arrogant, and downright disrespectful both to the President of the United States and to the moderator...unworthy of this or any other position requiring care for the 99% who don't live the high life.

President Obama is a true leader, thoughtful and principled, compassionate and, yes, just plain smarter than anyone the Republicans have been able to find...could it be that nobody with half a conscience is willing to become a contortionist to become President? Perhaps no person with scruples wants to be beholden to unelected leaders like Grover Norquist or the Koch Brothers?

AGAIN...THANK YOU PRESIDENT OBAMA...YOU MADE US PROUD TONIGHT!
I remember back in High School quite a few guys had "binders full of women" - maybe that wasn't the most elegant wording.

Things I learned:

Mitt Romney HATES birds apparently, especially big yellow ones.

Mitt Romney once had 'binders full of women'.

Obama's (pension) isn't as big as Romney's

Obama is not to be called "Mr. Oil, Mr. Gas, or Mr. Coal" (no "Mr. Leader" either please).

Libya? Sorry, just not gonna decide the election.

Both Corporatist candidates were in complete denial of the planetary crises of Peak Oil and Climate Change. People are putting their bodies on the line to prevent the planetary destructive impact of tar sands oil. Instead of talking about getting out of our cars and providing Green Transit both Romney and Obama peddled the delusion that the US can be energy independent by drill drill drill.
The US will indeed be energy independent when Saudi Arabia and the oil exporters run out of oil to export. Instead of stopping the Wars consuming 5% of US oil usage or Auto Addiction by providing a Green New Deal of Green Transit, both Romney and Obama are in utter denial.

http://www.peakprosperity.com/crashcourse

For more info on Peak Oil

I spent the debate analyzing responses and found myself drawn to President Obama's remarks.  When he ended the debate with the remark about "47%" I knew the debate was over and he had scored a knockout.

If Romney said this: "On day one, I will label China a currency manipulator, which will allow me as president to be able to put in place, if necessary, tariffs where I believe that they are taking unfair advantage of our manufacturers" I think people should pay very close attention.

"I will label XXX reality as YYY reality, and by my powers as president I will be able to do anything I believe"?? Seriously dangerous mindset!!!

The President with substance, style, grace and strength capably describe how his administration has worked hard for all
Americans after being handed a mess from George Bush. He exposed Romney's lies. Mr. Romney didn't get away with bullying and dominating the debate like last time because the President stood his ground and Candy Crowly did her job as a moderator.

Not only would Romney bully but of course he would bully a female moderator! That really turned me off. No respect for others in authority, no respect for women. (He must have thought that Crowley should get flextime to cook for her family and not waste her sweet little head on such things like being an internationally televised debate moderator. And he be oh so proud of how he "supported" her by getting her time off.

President Obama clearly stated WHY he should be re-elected and his demeanor showed his strong leadership. Romney stated talking points and in so doing many of us learned how little he knows women or about Affirmative Action. How could he not know any women who could be part of his leadership team?
I thought Candy Crowley did a good job of handling a difficult situation. Romney had bullied his way through the past debate and when he tried this time, she tried very hard to reign him in and she also had to stop President Obama who was not going to be bullied this time.
I would expect WOMEN to realize that President Obama is the person who will best protect our rights and thus vote for him. He can better understand women's challenges including the glass ceiling which so many of us have faced.
Get your friends together and head out to VOTE and to VOLUNTEER for President Obama!

I do not judge these candidates by what they say in a debate 3 weeks before the election. Each one of them and their parties
have a long history; Republicans have a history of opposing Social Security, Medicare, civil rights and now Obamacre. Why would anyone trust govrner Romney and his party now on any of these issues.

Romney came across as an arrogant bully who was disrespectful to the president and the moderator. He strikes me as someone who would run roughshod over anyone who disagrees with him. We do not need an oligarch in the White House.

Romney once appeared like a used car dealer, only this time no sell.
He was arrogant, never admitted to making a mistake and can maneuver around any questions about his income tax returns and his great plan for closing the loopholes for the rich. He has a a binder full of blank pages

Great job Mr. President.

Regarding Romney -- I can't figure why he keeps pushing an end or lowering the rate of taxes for capital gains and dividends. I think he honestly believes he's talking to the middle class when he says that. That's upper class stuff and such a change in taxes helps Romney himself. I don't get him at all. And I don't want to.
It would be a good image but it would bring down the wrath of PETA, which is not how anyone wants to spend the next several weeks.

One more Willard Etch-a-Sketch performance. What does he stand for anyway? The 3% of "small businesses" that claim the 15% tax rate from what I gather. Those "small businesses" like Bain in other words.

A good Obama campaign ad would be a voice over of a fish flip-flopping around in the bottom of a boat. Although I think the fish would still be more consistent.

Him and his 5 point plan. Five points we still no nothing about. It sounds like a Soviet era 5 year plan to me.

This is what the republican party has sunk to. Pathetic.

I thought it was Shakespearean, with the Usurper showing treason. In short, Obama won a great triumph here, Great Job, Mr. President!
You spoke truth to one of the powerful.

You are right but I use more decnt term, Obama override him this time.

For me Romney's pitifulness is coming from, a moderate republican us trying hard to get vote from extremist right wing and In national election he has to appease entire moderates in the nation.

In this perspective, Romney campaign is schizophrenic because it is giving dual input. it is excatly happenig in fornt of our eyes.

"Self-destroying reverse zinger of the night. Romney re equal opportunities for women: 'I had a binder full of women.'"

------------

You know, a certain male-someone in my life has a binder like that. Stored behind some tools in his workshop. We pretend I don't know about it... I know he would NEVER bring it up in public. Mrs. Romney must be SO embarrassed.
I just sent mine in!

sorry, but you're not correct. Wall Street has abandoned the President; major contributions are all going to Romney.
http://www.politico.com/news/stories/0612/77368.html
Romney does blow a lot of wind...

Honest question, but what facts did he clarify? All I heard were criticisms of the President. Wouldn't you agree that after the largest economic collapse since the Great Depression that restoring the economy to a reasonable level isn't going to be easy? Wouldn't you agree that criticizing the President for not doing more in 4 years is incredibly easy to do? How is Gov Romney really going to get things done? Because what I heard was "trust me". What politician have you ever believed that from? What about one that has offered no specifics on what he will do?

Considering your rhetoric, pardon me for not believing you were undecided. You sound like a Romney campaign aide.

In any case, if you were undecided, you don't switch, you decide.
